metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6541 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The ccid3_hc_tx_getsockopt function in net/dccp/ccids/ccid3.c in the Linuxkernel before 3.6 does not initialize a certain structure, which allowslocal users to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory via acrafted application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-5-manta - 3.4.0-5.22
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
